snippet: In early testimony in the criminal trial of James (Whitey) Bulger, who is charged with racketeering and murder, witnesses shared their concepts of honor and loyalty.
abstract: Concept of honor, especially in the noble pursuit of protecting family and friends, has been a subtext in the racketeering and murder trial of James (Whitey) Bulger since the moment it opened; defense has taken unusual tack of immediately acknowledging that Bulger is guilty of some of the charges against him, but is insisting Bulger would never, under the codes of honor defining his world, kill a woman or become an informant.
lead_paragraph: In early testimony in the criminal trial of James (Whitey) Bulger, who is charged with racketeering and murder, witnesses shared their concepts of honor and loyalty.

headline.main: In Bulger’s Underworld, a ‘Judas Was the Worst’
headline.print_headline: In Bulger’s Underworld, a ‘Judas Was the Worst’
